intro: Polygala amara subsp. brachyptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered in spicate inflorescences, typically in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
